revised_title: Theory of Luminosity Produced in Certain Substances by Alpha-Rays
tldr: The author investigates the decay of luminosity produced by alpha-rays in zinc sulfide, willemite, and barium platinocyanide. The theory suggests that the decay of luminosity is due to the destruction of active centers in the material, which are ionized and dissociated by alpha-particles. The intensity of scintillations decreases as the number of active centers is reduced, in agreement with experimental results.
